title: Constructivist-Based Mathematical Operations Project Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Students use personalized computational problem-generation software on personal devices (tablets/laptops), while teachers monitor individual progress via real-time performance reports; collaborative learning facilitates shared problem-solving and feedback

learning_goals: Students can independently solve complex operation problems within 10 steps with 80% accuracy.
Learners can logically explain the problem-solving process by applying the order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS rules).
Through team projects, learners can write reports applying complex operations to real-life cases (e.g., shopping calculations, timetable analysis).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
